title: August 8
description:
Just a few days left before moving to France!

We've been on a massive house purge. Things are getting thrown away, packed in the garage, or mailed to France. The place is looking empty.

We've been seeing a few old friends one last time, with lots of promises that people will come to visit.

children.title: Allowance 1
children.description:
When we learned Felix had somehow saved up $50, and the only thing he chose to spend a portion of that money on was a present for Milo, we decided it was past time to give him an allowance.

We're giving him 8 dollars or euros per month: one $/€ per year of age.

It's not contingent on accomplishing any chores, but we are asking him to help more around the house - such as taking in a few dishes from the table that aren't his own.

children.title: Allowance 2
children.description: He asked for $4 now and €4 later.

children.title: Dean's Knee
children.description:
Dean hurt his knee last weekend and wasn't able to walk most of the week. It's only THIS weekend he's been ambulatory without crutches or cane.

The doctors think it's either a knee sprain or a torn cartilege (meniscus). Either way, the treatment is ice and elevation. That's what he's been doing most of the week.

It definitely put a cramp in our efforts to pack up the house. For instance, he was going to sell the motorcycle, but now it'll just have to get mothballed.

Fortunately, THIS weekend he's doing much better and will be able to walk onto the plane. Yay!

children.title: Stitches
children.description:
In other health news, Dean found out that he had a nonlethal skin cancer! It's on his left forearm and is called "squamous cell carcinoma in situ" a.k.a. Bowen's disease. It's not usually dangerous.

The doctor cut it out and sent it to the lab to make sure he got it all.

This has left Dean with 14 stitches: it looks like Dr. Frankenstein sewed his arm on.

The stitches may get removed Monday; otherwise, we'll be trying out Europe's heath services sooner than hoped for. Their insurance CAN'T be any worse to deal with than America's.
